The reduced gravity would cause the oceans to lose a significant amount of water, resulting in lower sea levels and potentially altering coastlines and landmasses.
The reduced gravity would affect the way animals and plants grow and move, leading to new adaptations and behaviors.
The reduced gravity would cause buildings and structures to sway and oscillate, requiring new architectural designs and engineering solutions to maintain stability.
The reduced gravity would have a profound impact on the way we perceive time and space, potentially leading to new scientific discoveries and theories.

The reduced gravity would cause a shift in the balance of power between nations and organizations, as countries and entities with greater resources and capabilities would be better equipped to adapt to the new conditions.
